INTERFERE.Definition: to involve yourself in a situation when your involvement is not wanted or is not helpful

BROWSER.Definition: a computer programme that makes it possible for you to read information on the internet

BROWSING.Definition: to look at information on the internet

LAYERS.Definition: a level of material, such as a type of rock or gas, that is different from the material above or below it, or a thin sheet of a substance

ENCRYPTION.Definition: the process of changing electronic information or signals into a secret code (= system of letters, numbers, or symbols) that people cannot understand or use without special equipment

PARALLEL.Definition: something very similar to something else, or a similarity between two things

ANALOGY.Definition: a comparison between things that have similar features, often used to help explain a principle or idea

ENABLE.Definition: to make someone able to do something, or to make something possible

TRACE.Definition: to find the origin of something

BROADLY.Definition: in a general way, without considering specific examples or all the details

IDEOLOGICAL.Definition: based on or relating to a particular set of ideas or beliefs

THIRD PARTIES.Definition: a third person or organisation less directly involved in a matter than the main people or organisations that are involved

AUTHORITARIAN.Definition: demanding that people obey completely and refusing to allow them freedom to act as they wish

SHADY.Definition: sheltered from direct light from the sun

PURPOSE.Definition: why you do something or why something exists

TRACED.Definition: to find someone or something that was lost

TRACEABLE.Definition: possible to find or follow, especially using technology

FIREARMS.Definition: guns that can be carried easily

CONCURRENT.Definition: happening or existing at the same time

MASTERMIND.Definition: to plan a difficult activity, often a crime, in detail and make certain that it happens successfully

CONDEMNED.Definition: criticise something or someone strongly, usually for moral reasons

ENCRYPTED.Definition: to change electronic information or signals into a secret code (= system of letters, numbers, or symbols) that people cannot understand or use on normal equipment

SNOOPING.Definition: to look around a place secretly, in order to discover things or find out information about someone or something

EXPOSE.Definition: to make public something bad or dishonest

MALPRACTICE.Definition: failure to act correctly or legally when doing your job, often causing injury or loss

WHISTLEBLOWERS.Definition: a person who tells someone in authority about something illegal that is happening, especially in a government department or a company

PUBLIC DOMAIN.Definition: if information is in the public domain, it is available for everyone to see or know about

REPRISALS.Definition: (an example of) activity against another person, especially as a punishment by military forces or a political group

TRANSPARENCY.Definition: a situation in which business and financial activities are done in an open way without secrets, so that people can trust that they are fair and honest

MISINTERPRET.Definition: to form an understanding that is not correct of something that is said or done

THE LATTER.Definition: the second of two people, things, or groups previously mentioned

JUMP TO THE CONCLUSION.Definition: to guess the facts about a situation without having enough information

FAUSTIAN PACT.Definition: A pact whereby a person trades something of supreme moral or spiritual importance, such as personal values or the soul, for some worldly or material benefit, such as knowledge, power, or riches
